results.title: Exploding Fist +  for ZX Spectrum 48/128/+2
results.creator_credit: Firebird Software, Telecomsoft and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Exploding Fist + [computer game]. Exploding Fist + is a side view beat ‘em up for up to three players. Players fight increasingly tougher opponents to rank as 10th Dan with a wide variety of karate kicks, punches, cartwheels and blocks. Once players have attained the rank of 10th Dan, they must then defend their title against more opponents. Players either score eight points or have the most before the bout ends. Points are scored by striking a fighter. The two highest scoring fighters progress to the next bout. If there is a tie, a replay bout will take place. After every two bouts, surviving players can play a bonus game where they throw ninja stars at demons hiding in a dark alley for additional points.

results.title: Exploding cities
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells and Tina Viljoen
results.brief_description: At the beginning of this century earth was still a rural planet. By the year 2000, two out of three of us will be living in cities. This film examines the causes of this massive migration, the terrible poverty that ensues, and what steps are being taken in some cities in the developing world to cope with the great influx of people. It also notes attempts made by some countries to deal with the problem, e.g. sites and services programs in Senegal and Pakistan, self-help construction projects in Colombia, and house upgrading schemes in Zambia. Voice and narration by Bronwyn Drainie.

results.title: Explaining matter: chemical change. 2nd edition.
results.brief_description: Explains the process involved in chemical change. Identifies the parts of the atom and explains atomic structure. Discusses atomic bonding, both ionic and covalent. Shows the ability to predict chemical change has permitted the creation of new substances and introduces the relationships between chemical changes and molecular arrangements.
results.description: Explains the process involved in chemical change. Identifies the parts of the atom and explains atomic structure. Discusses atomic bonding, both ionic and covalent. results.title: Experiments with a bubble model of a metal structure
results.brief_description: A new version of Sir Lawrence Bragg’s famous analogue using bubbles on the surface of a liquid to demonstrate such phenomena as elastic and plastic deformation, dislocation and recrystallisation. A number of small bubbles of uniform size, blown on the surface of a soap solution, represents fairly accurately one cross-section of a metal structure. This bubble model is used to demonstrates the formation fo crystals in a metal, the slow production of larger crystals and the development of faults and slip planes.

results.title: Experiments in three colour separation
results.brief_description: A documentary of the work of Arthur and Corinne Cantrill since 1975 in 3-colour separation. Discusses the classic theories and principles in 3-colour separation in film and photography. Commentary by Arthur Cantrill.

results.title: Experiments in the revival of organisms (D)
results.brief_description: A record of successful Russian experiments in resuscitating dead animals. The apparatus used is shown and the resuscitation of a dead dog illustrated step by step. The film raises question about the true physiological nature of death. WARNING: CONTAINS DISTURBING SCENES OF ANIMAL EXPERIMENTATION.

results.title: Experiments in motion graphics
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In this documentary film exploring his working processes, John Whitney explains some of the techniques and philosophies involved in programming and animating his computer-made abstract films. He attempts to define his new art of ‘motion graphics’ by comparison with music and language. As well as an intriguing investigation into his work, this film is a visual feast of his remarkable dynamic abstractions.
results.description: In this documentary film exploring his working processes, John Whitney explains some of the techniques and philosophies involved in programming and animating his computer-made abstract films. He attempts to define his new art of ‘motion graphics’ by comparison with music and language. As well as an intriguing investigation into his work, this film is a visual feast of his remarkable dynamic abstractions.

results.title: Experimental design
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC-TV and Victor Lockwood
results.brief_description: Rhys L.L. Davies demonstrates his innovative method of teaching fractions to primary school children. He discusses the methodology he used to test his method against traditional text books and Quizinnaire. Shows Rhys using the three methods with his students in class.
